form.name: form1

p.span: Gov. Tom Wolf announced that all Pennsylvania Public Schools will remain closed for the remainder of the school year. Remote Planned Instruction will begin on Monday, April 13.

img.data-caption: Visit our Planned Instruction website below for more details.
img.alt: Continuing quality education in Peters Township

img.data-caption: PTHS celebrated the arts with a week of performances and art displays.
Students visited technology exhibits and hands on demonstrations in this annual event.
img.alt: students talk with a vendor at technology day

img.data-title: Mary Poppins Jr. on Stage at PTMS
img.data-caption: Middle School students share the magic and positivity of Mary Poppins!
img.alt: Students on stage during the Mary Poppins musical.

img.data-caption: Pleasant Valley students celebrated with some mystery readers in their classroom!
img.alt: Mrs. Barry reads to Mr. Cirincione's class.

img.data-caption: McMurray Elementary students know that learning gives them wings and opens up a world of opportunities. What are you learning today?
img.alt: A student stand in the "wings" at McMurray Elementary.

img.data-title: The Latest Look at the New PTHS
img.data-caption: Construction continues at the construction site for the new PTHS.
img.alt: view from the new construction of the high school.

img.data-title: Will You Be the "I" in KIND?
img.data-caption: Pleasant Valley students are pledging to continue the chain reaction of kindness!
img.alt: A student is the "I" in the word KIND.

img.style: border-width:0px;width: 41px; vertical-align: middle; padding: 10px; border-left: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.12); border-right: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.12);

div.style: float:left; width:100%; margin-top:-506px; border-top:5px solid white; position:relative; z-index:99999;

div.span: Welcome to Peters Township School District! Every day we welcome more than 4,300 students into our classrooms to challenge and support their efforts in academics, activities and athletics. While we are widely known for our academic achievements across the state, the success of our students goes well beyond those statistics. Our dedicated and experienced staff seeks to have a positive impact on the lives of each student during their time in Peters Township – with each student we reach, we are making our mark.

br.span: With the indefinite closure of schools across the state, Peters Township will transition from informal learning experiences to formal planned instruction on April 13, 2020. Resources for students and parents may be found on the Planned Instruction website.

Our District Leadership Team will be available to address the individual questions that will arise over the next few weeks. Please click the headline for a list of contacts for questions pertaining to various aspects of the District.

The Peters Township School District is closely following the information that is evolving regarding the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). For travel guidelines and resources for families, visit our Health Services website.

Our goal is to promote and spread kindness in our community, building upon the solid foundation of Peters Township Character Counts and Rachel’s Challenge. PTYOK is designed to promote kindness events and help connect people who want to help with activities in our area. Visit https://ptyok.org/ to get started!

The Peters Township School District Kennywood Picnic day is Tuesday, June 16, 2020. Discounted tickets will be on sale in District school buildings on Wednesday, May 6. This year, tickets are $29 each and may be purchased by cash or money order only. Click more info for specific times to purchase tickets in each building.

img.title: Are you ready for Rachel's Challenge?
img.alt: Are you ready for Rachel's Challenge?

br.span: Peters Township School District is proud to continue our Rachel’s Challenge Program for the 2019-2020 school year. As many of you know, last year we introduced this important initiative to our students and community and Peters Township eagerly embraced this effort at all grade levels.

img.title: Planning for the Future: New PTHS
img.alt: Planning for the Future: New PTHS
img.a: Planning for the Future: New PTHS

br.span: Learn more about the plan for the future for the new Peters Township High School - the history of the project, current updates and ways you can stay connected. Visit our New PTHS Project page.

img.title: District Highlights from School Board Meetings
img.alt: District Highlights from School Board Meetings

br.span: At each month's Board Meeting we celebrate accomplishments throughout the District in the areas of academics, the arts, athletics, character education and leadership. This slide show begins each meeting - take a look!

Peters Township has partnered with the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania to provide the Safe2Say Something (S2SS) program. This anonymous reporting system allows students in grades 7-12 to safetly and quickly report any issues where a student may be a threat to themselves or others. Click the headline to learn more.

br.span: Monday, May 18, 2020
Peters Township School District will promote academic excellence, build leadership, and inspire character as a prominent Pennsylvania School District measured by state and national standards.

With the indefinite closure of schools across the state, Peters Township will transition from informal learning experiences to formal planned instruction on April 13, 2020. Resources for students and parents may be found on the Planned Instruction website.

Our District Leadership Team will be available to address the individual questions that will arise over the next few weeks. Please click the headline for a list of contacts for questions pertaining to various aspects of the District.

The Peters Township School District is closely following the information that is evolving regarding the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). For travel guidelines and resources for families, visit our Health Services website.

Our goal is to promote and spread kindness in our community, building upon the solid foundation of Peters Township Character Counts and Rachel’s Challenge. PTYOK is designed to promote kindness events and help connect people who want to help with activities in our area. Visit https://ptyok.org/ to get started!

The Peters Township School District Kennywood Picnic day is Tuesday, June 16, 2020. Discounted tickets will be on sale in District school buildings on Wednesday, May 6. This year, tickets are $29 each and may be purchased by cash or money order only. Click more info for specific times to purchase tickets in each building.
